title: Oregon State to co-lead $30 million USDA regional food business center - Oregon State University
summary: Oregon State University will co-lead a $30 million USDA regional food business center aimed at supporting farmers and food businesses in accessing markets and resources. The center will serve six states and focus on strengthening local supply chains, connecting food entrepreneurs, supporting climate-resilient agriculture, and improving communication with investors. It will emphasize historically underserved communities and involve collaboration with various partners. The initiative is part of a larger $400 million effort to enhance local and regional food systems.
green_innovation: TRUE: The initiative supports climate-resilient agriculture and strengthens local food supply chains, contributing to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE: The center aims to provide new or improved processes and services for food-related businesses, aligning with the definition of business innovation.
green_product: FALSE: The article does not mention any specific goods or services that meet the definition of a green product.
green_process: TRUE: The focus on climate-resilient agriculture and improving supply chains can be seen as green processes that minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 111 - Crop Production; 112 - Animal Production and Aquaculture; 311 - Food Manufacturing; 541 - Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services
greenwashing: FALSE: There is no indication of greenwashing in the article; rather, it describes a legitimate initiative aimed at supporting sustainable food systems.

title: Bill would shield recyclers from PFAS cleanup costs - Resource Recycling
summary: A new bill introduced in the U.S. Senate exempts composting and solid waste facilities from cleanup liability under CERCLA for environmental contamination from PFAS chemicals. The legislation, backed by several Senate Republicans, aims to protect these facilities if they managed biosolids containing PFAS, with exceptions for gross negligence. The bill has received support from various waste management associations as states begin to regulate PFAS use more strictly.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the bill supports the management of composting and recycling facilities in a way that aims to lessen the environmental burden from PFAS contamination, thus promoting sustainable waste management practices.
business_innovation: TRUE, because the legislation proposes a significant change in liability concerning waste management processes, representing an improvement in business regulations affecting the recycling and composting industries.
green_product: FALSE, as the article does not discuss a specific green product but rather addresses legislative changes related to waste management practices.
green_process: TRUE, because the article refers to the processes involved in composting and recycling facilities and their efforts to manage PFAS contamination in a way that aligns with reducing environmental impact.
company: National Waste & Recycling Association, Solid Waste Association of North America, US Composting Council, Waste Management

greenwashing: FALSE, because the article does not make false claims about environmental benefits but discusses proposed legislation aimed at addressing real environmental concerns regarding PFAS contamination.

title: UM Announces New U.S. Leadership Across Growth, Strategy, Planning, Intelligence, Client Services and Operations - PR Newswire
summary: UM has appointed new U.S. leadership as part of a strategy to enhance their service offerings and client relationships. The new executives include Grant Ogburn as Chief Growth Officer, Myia Thompkins as Chief Strategy Officer, and others who will strengthen the agency's capabilities. title: The challenges of greenhouse gas accounting in the UK's waste and recycling sector - Ricardo PLC
summary: The waste and recycling sector in the UK is making strides towards achieving net zero greenhouse gas emissions, facing challenges related to emissions accounting and data reporting. While significant progress has been made with a 73% emissions reduction since 1990, the sector needs better frameworks for accounting avoided emissions and more accessible data to quantify their efforts accurately. Recent government policies require significant organizations to publish Carbon Reduction Plans, further emphasizing the importance of GHG emissions in procurement decisions. Ricardo has been actively helping companies in the sector navigate these challenges to achieve their net zero targets.
green_innovation: TRUE: The article discusses efforts within the waste and recycling sector to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and improve sustainability, which aligns with the definition of green innovation.
business_innovation: FALSE: The article does not focus on a new or improved product or business process that has been introduced to the market; instead, it discusses general practices and challenges in emissions accounting.
green_product: FALSE: The text does not specify a particular good or service that meets the definition of a green product.
green_process: TRUE: The article describes processes in the waste and recycling sector aimed at minimizing environmental impacts and supporting sustainability goals, aligning with the definition of a green process.

greenwashing: FALSE: The article does not appear to engage in greenwashing, as it presents genuine efforts and challenges faced by the waste and recycling sector in achieving sustainability and reducing greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Tesla Teases Two New EVs That Could Sell More Than 5 Million Units Per Year - CarScoops
summary: Elon Musk announced at Tesla's 2023 Annual Shareholders Meeting that the company is developing two new electric vehicles (EVs) expected to sell over 5 million units annually. He emphasized that both the design and manufacturing techniques of these products are superior to industry standards. While specific details were scarce, the announcement has raised high expectations among shareholders. Rumors suggest that these products may include facelifts for the existing Model 3 and Model Y, focusing on cost efficiency and technological advancements.

business_innovation: TRUE, as Tesla is introducing new and improved products (the new EVs) that significantly differ from previous products and are intended for market launch.
green_product: TRUE, because the new EVs are designed and manufactured to significantly reduce environmental impacts throughout their life cycle, aligning with the definition of a green product.

title: Hershey releases environmental, social and governance report highlighting sustainability targets - Confectionery Production
summary: The Hershey Company has emphasized its sustainability goals in its 2022 ESG Report, reporting strong performance while addressing environmental impacts and diversity. The company's Cocoa For Good strategy aims to invest $500 million by 2030 to improve the lives of cocoa farming communities and achieve full sourcing visibility by 2025. Hershey is also focusing on reducing greenhouse gas emissions and enhancing water efficiency, alongside initiatives for employee diversity and inclusion. Their commitment includes transitioning to sustainable practices, such as using biofuels and improving training programs for employees.
green_innovation: TRUE: The article describes multiple initiatives by Hershey aimed at reducing environmental impact and promoting sustainability, including investments in cocoa farming communities and strategies to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
business_innovation: TRUE: The article discusses Hershey's commitment to enhancing its portfolio and operational resilience, indicating the introduction of improved business processes and sustainability-focused initiatives.
green_product: FALSE: The article does not mention a specific good or service that meets the definition of a green product.
green_process: TRUE: The article describes Hershey's efforts to transition from coal to biofuels and implement real-time utility usage data systems to reduce energy intensity, both of which align with the definition of a green process.

title: B.C. government pledges additional $25 million for coastal cleanup - Aldergrove Star
summary: The B.C. government has invested $25 million into the Clean Coast, Clean Waters Initiative Fund, aiming to restore and protect the marine environment by removing derelict vessels and cleaning up marine debris along the coastline. This initiative not only creates over 1,700 jobs but also focuses on recycling marine debris, with 64% of the collected materials being recycled or up-cycled. Additionally, it emphasizes collaboration with First Nations for sustainable resource management, aiming to improve community quality of life and transfer Indigenous knowledge. The initiative is part of the CleanBC Plastics Action Plan, which seeks to reduce plastic waste and pollution while developing a Coastal Marine Strategy for long-term stewardship of marine ecosystems.
green_innovation: TRUE - This is green innovation because it contributes to environmental sustainability by removing marine debris and derelict vessels, promoting recycling, and protecting marine ecosystems.
business_innovation: TRUE - This is a business innovation as it involves a new funding initiative and processes aimed at cleaning the marine environment, which significantly differs from past efforts.
green_product: FALSE - While the initiative involves cleaning and recycling materials, it does not describe a specific good or service that fits the green product definition.
green_process: TRUE - This is a green process as it involves methods to clean up marine debris and derelict vessels while minimizing environmental impacts and promoting sustainability through recycling.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 221310 - Water Supply and Irrigation Systems; 562910 - Remediation Services; 921120 - Legislative Bodies; 813312 - Environment, Conservation and Wildlife Organizations
greenwashing: FALSE - The article does not present misleading information regarding environmental benefits but instead discusses a successful initiative aimed at protecting marine ecosystems.

title: Top 10 Best Smart Home Companies In India In 2023 - Inventiva
